Name: HMS Ledbury
awards:
Malta (1942) & (1942),
Arctic (1943),
Sicily (1943),
Salerno (1943),
Adriatic (1944),
Aegean (1944).
Notes: Sailed in convoys PQ 12, PQ 13, PQ 14, PQ 15, PQ 16, PQ 17, QP 9, QP 10, QP 15, JW 51A, JW 51B, JW 52, RA 51 & RA 53.
Propulsion: 2 Admiralty 3-drum boilers, 2 shaft Parsons geared turbines, 19,000 shp
Speed: 27 kn (50 km/h; 31 mph) (25.5 kn (47.2 km/h; 29.3 mph) full)
Armament:
6 × QF 4 in Mark XVI on twin mounts Mk. XIX
4 × QF 2 pdr Mk. VIII on quad mount MK.VII
2 × 20 mm Oerlikons on single mounts P Mk. III
110 depth charges, 2 throwers, 3 racks
